intro: Blabeia endlicheri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically has thick, waxy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom from spring to autumn. Blabeia endlicheri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
